    public interface IComponent
extends IHasAttributes
    A standard component interface.

    Note that this interface is compatible with the Java Bean specification.

    The main intention of this common interface is to provide a standard mechanism by which the current state of components can be altered and monitored.

    The constructor should do as little as possible. The sequence of events should be as follows:

    • openComponent - configure component and allocate any resources required.
    • setComponentActive( true ) - Start operation of component.
    • setComponentActive( false ) - Suspend operation. Can be restarted if needed.
    • closeComponent - Shut down component operation. Free any allocated resources.

      • NOT_EFFECTED_BY_HIGH_AVAILABILITY

static final String NOT_EFFECTED_BY_HIGH_AVAILABILITY
        Deprecated. Deprecated as of Catalys 1.0. Use SERVICE_ALWAYS_ACTIVE instead
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • SERVICE_ALWAYS_ACTIVE

        static final String SERVICE_ALWAYS_ACTIVE
        Used by the application when running in HA mode for those IServices that are also IComponents.

        A service that happens to be an IComponent is normally activated through its setComponentActive(boolean) method when either of the following happens:

        • the application does not run in HA mode and gets started
        • or the application runs in HA mode and it becomes primary
        This means that when in HA mode, a service is normally not activated until the application becomes primary.

        However, there are cases where it's desirable for a service to always be active, regardless of the application's HA role. In such situations, a service can set this attribute to true in order to tell the application that it should always be activated at startup, and to tell the HA sub-system that it should never be deactivated, even if the application is not primary.

        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

    • Method Detail

      • openComponent

        boolean openComponent()
               throws Exception
        Component configures itself. This method will only be called once during the component lifecycle.
        Returns:
        Previous open state.
        Throws:
        Exception - if it is unable to properly configure itself.

      • closeComponent

        boolean closeComponent()
                throws Exception
        Component permanently ceases operation. Any allocated resources should be returned.

        No other component methods will be called after this.

        Returns:
        Previous open state.
        Throws:
        Exception - if it was unable to completely close. It should not throw an exception until it has closed itself as fully as possible.

      • setComponentActive

        boolean setComponentActive(boolean active)
                    throws Exception
        Component start/stops operation.

        An alternative is to use setAttribute( ACTIVE_KEY, Boolean ).

        Parameters:
        active - if true component starts/resumes operation otherwise it stops/pauses.
        Returns:
        Previous active state.
        Throws:
        Exception - if it was unable to change its mode of operation.

      • isComponentActive

        boolean isComponentActive()
        Return whether the component is currently operating.

        An alternative is to use getAttribute( ACTIVE_KEY ) which should return an object of type Boolean.

        Returns:
        true if the component is currently operating.

      • isComponentOpen

        boolean isComponentOpen()
        Return whether the open method has been called on this component.
        Returns:
        true if the open method has been called.

      • getComponentStatus

        IComponentStatus getComponentStatus()
        Returns the component's current state.

        Every component has state which can change with time. For example, the total number of objects a component has processed may be kept as part of its state.

        Attributes, by contrast, can only be changed by calling setAttribute.

        Returns:
        null if the component does not expose its state.
